p: C. papaya Linn. seeds exhibited good antioxidant capacity and are proven to be beneficial in the treatment of type-2 diabetes mellitus by inhibiting α-amylase and α-glucosidase enzymes ( 133). The immunomodulation activity is shown by constituents pheophorbide A and saponin obtained from leaves, which exhibited cytotoxic activity on SCC25 cancer cells and stimulated cell- and antibody-mediated immunity, respectively ( 134, 135). Leaf juice of the plant has been shown to significantly increase the plasma CCL2/MCP-1 level to treat DEN-2 dengue virus ( 12). Aqueous fruit extract thereof improved the immune functions against acrylamide-induced oxidative stress ( 136).
